description: From Latin hydragogus (“conveying off water”), from Ancient Greek [Term?] (“to lead”). Compare French hydragogue.

adjectives.description: hydragogue (comparative more hydragogue, superlative most hydragogue)

entries.meaning: (medicine) Causing a discharge of water; expelling serum effused into any part of the body, as in dropsy.
Any medicine of this kind, usually a cathartic or diuretic.
